newsitem.title: USA: Jury upholds award against Travelers.
newsitem.headline: Jury upholds award against Travelers.

text.p: A Superior Court in Oakland, California, has upheld a $26.5 million jury verdict against Travelers Property Casualty Corp in favor of a man who sued the insurance company for not providing him with legal counsel, the man's attorneys said Friday.
Attorneys for Gordon Vann said the award consisted of $1.46 million in compensatory damages and $25 million in punitive damages.

Vann, the operator of an auto-body shop, sued Travelers in 1993, after Travelers refused to provide him with an attorney in a lawsuit accusing Vann of contaminating the shop's property, said attorney Philip Pillsbury, an attorney with San Francisco law firm Pillsbury, Levinson & Mills.
John Williams, an attorney representing Travelers, declined comment and referred calls to the company's headquarters, where calls were unanswered Friday evening.
